vulnerabilities: External Control of File Name or Path
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
description: The function is vulnerable to path traversal attacks (CWE-22) because it uses user-supplied input to construct a file path without properly sanitizing it. This could allow an attacker to access, modify, or delete files outside of the intended directory. The function is also vulnerable to external control of file name or path (CWE-73) because it uses user-supplied input in the 'url' parameter to determine the name and location of a file to be written. This could allow an attacker to overwrite any file on the system. Finally, the function is vulnerable to injection attacks (CWE-94) because it uses user-supplied input in the 'url' parameter without properly sanitizing it. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious code into the function.
